text: when you start for two or three months
and then you drop it and then you start
for two or three months and then you
drop it you just get caught up in this
cycle for most people just starting out
we do see by about six months we get
about a 50% dropout in exercise programs
now there's two ways to look at that is
one how do we fix it how do we get it up
so people adhere longer the other part
too is it also tells you if you can get
to six months you're also in that group
that's most likely to adhere from then
on because at that six month part we
start to see a plateau and drop out so
it starts to become part of the
lifestyle now that being said there
aren't a real a lot of really long-term
studies on that those are hard to do you
know where you're talking two three four
year studies not easy but the ones that
have been done you know we don't see
this precipitous drop-off like we do in
the first six months it's pretty
exponential in the first six months but
then as you get to that six month part
it starts to Plateau so if we can get
you to that point it doesn't mean that
you'll never drop out it just means that
the likelihood is much much less than
that so aim for that six months you'd be
amazed at what you can do after that
